availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Stamper, Sr. (Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Catharine Dyer Stamper in Carter County, Kentucky, on October 24, 1844. Father of Sarah Elizabeth Stamper, William T. Stamper, George W. Stamper Jr., James M. Stamper, Andrew J. Stamper, Fairlena Stamper, Sylvenia Stamper, Joshua Stamper, Martha J. Stamper, and Mary A. Stamper. Farmer in Lewis County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Lewis County in 1860. Farmer in Lewis County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, District No 1, p. 236B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, pp. 946-947.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, Laurel Precinct, p. 478A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carter County Marriages, Film 001759301, pp. 22-23.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Lewis County, KY, October 1863, p. 135.
